column4: hello why i cant install wine? usind sudo aptitude install wine
then try   sudo apt-get install wine
that should have done it
Pici: no it just says No packages will be installed, upgraded, or removed. i have used before installing sudo aptitude update so i have all source lists.. strange
just for kicks....   sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
ive done sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
ooo ok
open system/preferences/main menu
see if it is listed in there
if it is  untick and re tick the box next to it....it will likely show up

I qam finding on lucid that installed applications do not always show up under the menus  right away...an old problem I never expected to see again... however  checking  in ghe main menu helps or just reboot
and "ghe"  is suppose to be "the"  sorry  damn fingers :)
im in xubuntu i dont have that menu. but i have file:///usr/share/applications/wine.desktop but it doesnt show up in menu.. maybe a new bug?
oooo then I am at a loss...did you try rebooting to see if the menu gets refreshed??/ there used to be  a  sudo update-menus   command which no longer exists as far as I can see
if all else fails... sudo apt-get autoremove --purge wine  and reinstall it
also ive experienced the same problem (programm item not showing but in applications folder it is) in another comp with google-gadgets-qt 2 days ago
yeah as I mentioned... I have noticed this issue in Lucid... its an old problem that should have never  shown up again
understood
did you open the Main Menu  and check?
nevermind  you said this is  xfce
sorry...did you say you already rebooted?

no i didnt restart.. that wont change anything for icons cache is beeing made every few minute. coz_: can u try sudo aptitude install google-gadgets-qt and see if it appears in menu? couse in 10.10 it didnt. and also i just installed in 10.04 on this one and also icon doesnt appear so thats some new bug.. if u can install then confirm it on Bug #610237
